unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Effect of Significance Level: Types of Error and Power
question_text:
If the significance level is increased it will:
I. Increase the probability of a type I error. II. Increase the probability of a type II error. III. Increase the power of a test.
solution:
If the significance level is increased then it is more likely that the null hypothesis will be rejected (meaning the alternative hypothesis is accepted).

The probability of a type I error is the significance level. When the significance level increases from $1\%$ to $5\%$ the probability of a type I error will increase from $1\%$ to $5\%$. Statement I is true.

Therefore we can eliminate Choices 'B' and 'D'.

Power is the probability that the null hypothesis is correctly rejected. When the significance level is increased, the probability of power increases as well. Statement III is true.

Therefore we can eliminate Choice 'A'.

Type II error is the complement of power so when the significance level increases the probability of a type II error will decrease. Therefore Statement II is false.

Therefore our answer is Choice 'C'.
